item.title: Ensuring employment through capacity building
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Gyumri Information Tecnologies Center has started another important cooperation with HSBC Armenia. HSBC Armenia, emphasizing the balanced development and empowerment of regions by promoting job creation through technological education, finances and supports the implementation of “Ensuring employment through capacity building” …
item.content:encoded:
Gyumri Information Tecnologies Center has started another important cooperation with HSBC Armenia.

HSBC Armenia, emphasizing the balanced development and empowerment of regions by promoting job creation through technological education, finances and supports the implementation of “Ensuring employment through capacity building” project in Tavush region. Socially disadvantaged individuals living in Tavush region, sufferers from Artshakh war and single mothers can apply for this program.

Within the framework of the program, the relevant beneficiaries have the opportunity to participate in the following courses free of charge:

  • Computer skills/basic skills
  • Web Programming (HTML/CSS/JavaScript)
  • Social Media Marketing (SMM)
  • Graphic Design

The courses have been held in a hybrid online and classroom format in cooperation with private companies in the field.

In addition to technical knowledge, the participants have received soft skills, as well as participated in interesting social events in Tavush region with HSBC Armenia and GITC representatives.

item.title: “University-Private Sector Cooperation for the Training of Specialists”
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Within the framework of the “University-Private Sector Cooperation for the Training of Specialists” grant program announced by the Ministry of High-Tech Industry of RA, GITC implements a 6-months Artificial Intelligence course. As a result of the implementation of the project, …
item.content:encoded:
Within the framework of the “University-Private Sector Cooperation for the Training of Specialists” grant program announced by the Ministry of High-Tech Industry of RA, GITC implements a 6-months Artificial Intelligence course.

As a result of the implementation of the project, educated and competitive specialists in the field of high technologies are formed, as well as re-specialized specialists have the opportunity to enter the technological sector.

item.title: “Women’s Economic Empowerment in High-Productivity Sector”
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: The “Women’s Economic Empowerment in High-Productivity Sector” program is implemented in partnership with the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs, funded by the UAE embassy and Zayed Charitable & Humanitarian Foundation. The goal of the project is to raise the …
item.content:encoded: The “Women’s Economic Empowerment in High-Productivity Sector” program is implemented in partnership with the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs, funded by the UAE embassy and Zayed Charitable & Humanitarian Foundation. The goal of the project is to raise the living standards of workable single mothers in the Shirak marz by promoting their livelihoods in a high-productivity sector. The programme includes three interconnected phases in high-productivity areas: 1. training in selected specialities in high-productivity areas (mostly technological), 2. Practical internships, 3. job placement. The programme targets the marz of Shirak, one of the most vulnerable marzes of Armenia in terms of poverty and unemployment rates. Within the framework of the project, 50 participants receive knowledge in the fields of Web programming, accounting, SMM and Computer basics.

item.title: “Young Innovators – Future Leaders” hackathon
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: “Young Innovators – Future Leaders” hackathon was organized by the EU4Business Innovative Tourism for Armenia project in cooperation with GITC – Information Technologies Center. The purpose of the initiative is to create innovative solutions tackling traditional sectors in Armenia and …
item.content:encoded: “Young Innovators – Future Leaders” hackathon was organized by the EU4Business Innovative Tourism for Armenia project in cooperation with GITC – Information Technologies Center. The purpose of the initiative is to create innovative solutions tackling traditional sectors in Armenia and economic issues unique to the local community. After receiving more than 100 applications, shortlisted teams were interviewed to present their ideas in detail, according to the idea teams were directed to mentoring sessions. “Young Innovators – Future Unicorns” Hackathon participants had pitching performances on June 5. Young innovators arrived from all regions of Armenia to jointly present technological solutions. 24 teams had pitches and presented their ideas aimed at strengthening our country. The most innovative ideas were selected from among the powerful ones with great difficulty.

item.title: “Technological skills to the war-affected people in Chambarak” project at Chambarak, Gegharkunik
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Previous Next “Technological skills to the war-affected people in Chambarak” project at Chambarak is implemented within the framework of the “Addressing the Crisis” grant initiative announced by Eurasia Partnership Foundation, funded by the European Union in cooperation with the GITC …
item.content:encoded:
Previous
Next
“Technological skills to the war-affected people in Chambarak” project at Chambarak is implemented within the framework of the “Addressing the Crisis” grant initiative announced by Eurasia Partnership Foundation, funded by the European Union in cooperation with the GITC and the “Soldier’s Mother” NGO․ As part of the project, Gyumri Information Technologies Center (GITC) in cooperation with Zinvori Mayr NGO will provide technology and entrepreneurship training in Chambarak community of Gegharkunik region for veterans of the 44-day Artsakh war and family members of the war victims. The main goal of the project is to reduce unemployment and improve the quality of life within the war-affected groups in Chambarak community by providing technological and business skills. Within the framework of the project, 30 participants from Chambarak receive knowledge in the fields of Web programming and business skills.

item.title: Improving the social conditions of the victims of the Artsakh war in Tavush region through capacity building
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: The aim of the “Improve the social conditions of the victims of the Artsakh war in Tavush region through capacity building” program is to support 100 individuals living in Tavush region, who are in a difficult social situation as a …
item.content:encoded:
The aim of the “Improve the social conditions of the victims of the Artsakh war in Tavush region through capacity building” program is to support 100 individuals living in Tavush region, who are in a difficult social situation as a result of the Artsakh events. Within the framework of this program, web programming courses are organised for the representatives of the target group, as well as they receive psychological and Financial Management / Accounting consultations. Our initiative has an impact on overcoming the psychological complex of the inferiority of the target group of the project, as the participants receive psychological support so that their reintegration into public life is complete. All participants of the program will have the opportunity to acquire a profession that is in demand in the modern labour market

The courses are held in:

  • Ijevan
  • Berd
  • Noyemberyan.

Date: May 2021 – in progress  

Previous
Next

item.title: “Deep Engineering Specialization in High School” program in Parakar
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Previous Next “Deep Engineering Specialization” free educational program implemented by the Gyumri Information Technologies centre with the support of Lebanese Armenian businessman Raffi Der Martirosyan, the Armenian Educational Foundation and the Fund for Armenian Relief. The 24-month program provides high …
item.content:encoded:
Previous
Next
“Deep Engineering Specialization” free educational program implemented by the Gyumri Information Technologies centre with the support of Lebanese Armenian businessman Raffi Der Martirosyan, the Armenian Educational Foundation and the Fund for Armenian Relief. The 24-month program provides high school students with relevant and competitive engineering skills to open more career opportunities for them․ The program was first time launched in 2021 in the National Polytechnic University of Armenia Gyumri branch and now there are 23 graduates in Gyumri, who has already manufactured buggy car. Since January Engineering Specialization in High School” program has been implemented in the Parakar community with 31 students. The objectives of Engineering education are Provide high school students with relevant and competitive engineering skills to open more career opportunities for them. Combine theoretical teaching with practical implementation in specially equipped classrooms. Create a pre-incubation program for the students to turn students’ ideas into prototypes with the help of mentors from the industry. Involve specialists and teachers from the industry: engineering and high-tech companies. Motivate high school students to build their future careers in Armenia and especially regions of Armenia. Building a career means the encouragement and belief to continue higher education in Armenian Universities; to be part-time employed by the private sector and serve to the development of the economy of Armenia. Engineering education has 4 specializations: Software Engineering (python; Machine Learning) Mechanical Engineering (3d modelling; operation on precision machines) Electrical Engineering (design and implementation of electrical control systems) Soft Skillset development (product development; project management; team building)

item.title: “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: The Armenian Educational Foundation implements the “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program in Gyumri high schools, cooperating with GITC. The uniqueness of the “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program is that the education is provided with …
item.content:encoded:
The Armenian Educational Foundation implements the “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program in Gyumri high schools, cooperating with GITC.

The uniqueness of the “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program is that the education is provided with practical and modern technologies.

The Armenian Educational Foundation is establishing the Engineering Laboratory in Gyumri branch of NPUA, equipped with special engineering mechanisms. Students will have the chance to apply their knowledge practically, which will give them a professional advantage.

The program gives students knowledge and skills in the following fields. 

  • Software engineering 
  • Mechanical engineering 
  • Electrical engineering 
  • Soft Skills

AEF and GITC are focused on education and social development, that’s why we launched the “Engineering Education in High School” free educational program.

 

Date: Feb 2021 – in progress

Previous
Next

item.title: Web programming training for discharged young men for military service
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Gyumri Information Technology Center educational foundation, funded by the Armenian Fund for Relief, conducted 6-month free training courses for discharged young men for military service or the youth of the military discharged, in conjunction with the Armenian Soldier’s Mother Charitable …
item.content:encoded:
Gyumri Information Technology Center educational foundation, funded by the Armenian Fund for Relief, conducted 6-month free training courses for discharged young men for military service or the youth of the military discharged, in conjunction with the Armenian Soldier’s Mother Charitable NGO. The program participants gained knowledge in HTML/CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Data Base, Linux, Adobe Photoshop, Discrete Mathematics, Algorithms Theory and English. At the end of the course participants designed websites, separate pages and apps. The program was implemented for one purpose: to enable servicemen or disadvantaged youth to enter the IT sector and have job opportunities.

Date: March 2019 – Oct 2019

Previous
Next

item.title: Boosting Technological Developments in Shirak Region
item.dc:creator: amalya
item.description: Through funding of the European Union and RA Ministry of Territorial Administration and Development, Microsoft Innovation Center Armenia and Gyumri Information Technologies Center implemented a new project, aiming to support economic development of Shirak marz through skill enrichment of unemployed young population and business development …
item.content:encoded:
Through funding of the European Union and RA Ministry of Territorial Administration and Development, Microsoft Innovation Center Armenia and Gyumri Information Technologies Center implemented a new project, aiming to support economic development of Shirak marz through skill enrichment of unemployed young population and business development of IT community. The project’s goal was to train the unemployed youth and enlarge the operation of existing IT companies in the region through skill enhancement of the companies in the form of business development and financial assistance.

Date: July 2017 – Dec 2018
